Galaxy Class

Module Galaxy builds a galaxy object.

class gal_class.Galaxy(mvir, cvir, data_vel, data_err, data_r)

Derive a dark matter density profile from a galaxy rotation curve

Parameters:

  • mvir (float) – galaxy virial mass (Msun)

  • cvir (float) – dark matter concentration parameter

  • data_vel (array) – galaxy velocity curve data (km/s)

  • data_err (array) – errors on galaxy velocity curve data (km/s)

  • data_r (array) – radial positions corresponding to galaxy velocity curve data (km)

Attibutes:

rhocrit (float): critical density of the universe (kg/m^3) fac (int): critical overdensity for defining virial radius mvir (float): galaxy virial mass (Msun) cvir (float): dark matter concentration parameter data_vel (array): galaxy velocity curve data (km/s) data_err (array): errors on galaxy velocity curve data (km/s) data_r (array): radial positions corresponding to galaxy velocity curve data (km)

delc()

Helper integral for computing the mass enclosed by the NFW profile

Returns:

value of helper integral

Return type:

float

log_like(x)

Calculate log-likelihood using the data and NFW parameters (c, log10(M_h))

Parameters:

x (array) – NFW parameters [log10(mvir), cvir]

Returns:

log likelihood

Return type:

float

mass_nfw()

Enclosed mass (virial mass in Msun, concentration parameter) in Msun

Returns:

mass profile at radial position of data_r

Return type:

array

ptform(x)

Prior transform

Parameters:

x (array) – two uniform samples between 0 and 1

Returns:

NFW parameters [log10(mvir), cvir]

Return type:

array

rho_nfw()

NFW density (virial mass in Msun, concentration parameter)

run_sampler()

Runs sampler

Returns:

dynesty sampler object
